name: General interest rate risk (GIRR) factor for standardised approach
description: The General Interest Rate Risk (GIRR) factor refers to the sensitivity of financial instruments to changes in risk-free interest rates across different maturities and currencies. These include risks from inflation and cross-currency basis spreads. (Article 325l) - Regulation (EU) No 575/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council (CRR)
